metadata.title: CVE-2017-15412 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in libxml2 before 2.9.5, as used in Google Chrome prior to63.0.3239.84 and other products, allowed a remote attacker to potentiallyexploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15412` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.5
libxml2-utils - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.5
python-libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

chromium-browser - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.5').
chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'Ubuntu touch end-of-life').
